name: Lorentz Factor
description: Relates measurements of distance and time intervals between different inertial frames in special relativity

name: Minkowski Metric
description: Defines the invariant spacetime separation on which all observers in flat spacetime can agree

name: Friedmann Equation
description: Describes how the rate of the Universe's expansion depends on its contents and spatial curvature

name: Fluid Equation
description: Models how the densities of different components evolve as the Universe expands or contracts

name: Acceleration Equation
description: Determines whether the expansion of the Universe is accelerating or decelerating based on its contents

name: Hubble Parameter
description: Measures the rate of expansion of the Universe over a given length scale at a specific time

name: Proper Distance (Present)
description: The proper distance between two points today, which is equal to their constant co-moving distance

name: Luminosity Distance
description: Relates the observed flux of a distant object to its known intrinsic luminosity

name: Angular Diameter Distance
description: Relates the observed angular size of a distant object to its known physical size

name: Saha Equation
description: Describes the ionization state of a gas in thermal equilibrium

name: Temperature Fluctuation
description: A dimensionless quantity describing the relative variation in CMB temperature across the sky

name: Multipole Expansion
description: Decomposes the pattern of CMB temperature fluctuations into a sum of spherical harmonic functions

name: Cosmic Variance
description: Represents the irreducible uncertainty in measuring the power spectrum from a single vantage point

name: Jeans Mass
description: The minimum mass needed for a gas cloud to overcome internal pressure and collapse under gravity

name: Virial Mass Estimate
description: Relates the total gravitating mass of a cluster to the observed radial velocities of its galaxies
